headline: Potato and Cheese Frittata
description: This potato and cheese frittata is great by itself or with some fruit on a Sunday morning.
name: Potato and Cheese Frittata
recipeIngredient: 2 large russet potatoes, peeled and shredded

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).

Heat oil in a 12 inch skillet over medium-high heat. When the skillet is hot, add the potatoes, and fry until crispy and golden, about 15 minutes. Reduce heat to medium, and add onions. Cook, stirring, until softened. Season with salt and pepper. Pour eggs over the potatoes and onions.

Place the skillet in the oven for about 10 minutes, or until eggs are firm. Remove from the oven, and sprinkle shredded cheese over the top. Return to the oven for about 5 minutes, or until cheese is melted.

review.reviewBody: Great basic recipe! We did beat the egg whites separately from the yolks then combined them. Nice and fluffy!! Good tip! We used shredded hash browns, onions, red bell peppers, garlic, cumin, paprika and a bit of cayenne pepper with diced low sodium ham with co-Jack cheese. Turned out great. Next time we’ll make Italian style!
HII,BEING A FOOD LOVER REALLY ATTRACTED ME TOWARD YOUR RECIPE. I^LL SUGGEST YOU TO ADD YOUR RECIPES ON KHAL.COM ,IN FORM OF PHOTO RECIPES THE PEOPLES WILL DEFINIETLY LOVE IT.
Delicious, we added sweet orange bell pepper. And one egg. And TONY'S SEASONING
Good basic recipe,I added bacon with the cheese and some garlic powder,we all liked it,but could've used another egg to make it fluffier.
I made mine using red potatoes diced thin & browned in olive oil in skillet, and I added diced ham & cherry tomatoes cut in half. DELICIOUS!!

I made this with some leftover diced potatoes from the previous night’s dinner. I also substituted egg whites for 4 of the eggs. For the rest, I just followed directions and it came out great. I am putting this on our regular breakfast menu.
Great to make the night before serving. Easy eating cold or hot.
We loved it. Followed almost exactly except I used red potatoes that was already cooked.

This is so easy! I cooked it in a copper baking pan and it slid out without any problem. I recomment a little tomato and sour cream as a garnish. It could easily be adapted to include other ingredients.

Good, quick starter recipe that you can add more ingredients that your family enjoys: i.e. mushrooms, garlic, spices, bacon, et. al. I appreciated Patty Crocker's recommendation to make a merengue (by separating egg whites from egg yolks, beating them separately and achieving stiff peaks with the egg whites and folding back into the blended egg yolks). I also par boiled the potatoes in salt water with baking soda -- the baking soda reduces is a great little trick that makes for much better baked or fried potatoes. Thank you for posting!
This was OK, I added ham cubes to it.

I doubled the recipe and used red onion. used 15" cast iron skillet. Next time I would add 2 more eggs to make it slightly thicker. really great for a quick meal that can easily be customized to your taste.

One of the most versatile recipes I've seen in years! I actually tweaked it a bit the second time I made it and used frozen hash browns, added real bacon bits and frozen spinach (I like spinach) to make it a more complete dinner and the entire thing was done and on the table in under 30 minutes.
I made this for my daughters and we love it. I doubled the recipe, added sausage and mushroom. I seasoned with salt, pepper, garlic salt. My daughters said this is a keeper.

Thanks for the idea! I was feeling particularly lazy so used what was left of a bag of Jimmy Dean sausage skillet (has potatos, onion and peppers). Made as written and topped with some Tabasco. May actually use less cheese next time but really easy and good.

Recipe is good place to start. I used leftover roasted potatoes and sweet potatoes, sautéed mushrooms, onions and red pepper. Seasoned with salt, pepper bit of garlic powder, onion powder, added a touch of thyme and my favourite herb with eggs tarragon. When I put in the casserole pan the beaten eggs didn't quite cover so added another 2 eggs baked for 10 mins added grated balder son cheddar cheese, baked another 7 mins. Served with sliced ripe tomatoes. Nice enough for company and easier than doing omelettes..
Needs a lot of salt. Instead of shredding the potatoes, I diced them and it gave it more of a "southern home cooked" feel (: This is a good recipe and it's super easy
This recipe is a bit bland as written but could serve as a good base. I may try it again with some additional herbs and vegetables because it's a substantial, wheat-free vegetarian option.

Good & Easy! I modified the recipe based on what was in the fridge. I used cooked red potatoes from another night. Sliced them thin. Also, I added finely chopped one garlic clove and red & yellow bell peppers cooked until soft in olive oil. Then, I did a sprinkling of chiffonade of spinach. Delicious!

Yummy! What a great way to use our cast iron skillet! This was my first time making frittata and I'm glad I picked the perfect recipe! 

Everyone in our family loved it! Their only critiques were, too much potato and that it needs more egg and meat. I'll definitely try making it with sausage next time. We'll be making this potato and cheese frittata again!

First time frittata maker. Turned out better than expected. I used sweet potatoes instead of regular potatoes and broccoli. Used 4 eggs, too dry...kind of looked like, I dunno, damp bread crumbs. Moved frittata from the skillet to a small glass baking pan, sprinkled on spices including jerk pepper sauce. Put it in oven for 7 mins, then added a fifth egg on top, put it back in oven, then added grated cheddar cheese. Definitely making again!

This recipe was very simple and delicious. I thinly sliced 2 Yucon Gold potatoes instead of shredding them. I like the way the finished product looked with the sliced potato. I also used a cup of cheese with 1/2 mixed in with the eggs and 1/2 added to the top as the recipe called for. I didn't find this bland at all. I think the other reviewers who described it as bland didn't add enough salt and pepper to the recipe. I served this with Salsa Verde for an extra kick.
It was wonderful. I added fresh mushrooms and home grown tomatoes!

This was delightful! I added some smoked sausage and some tomato slices and I love cheese so I added A LOT of it, my mother-in-law and daughter loved it. Mom was talking about how we need to make it more often and even make it for dinner and make some french toast or pancakes to go with it! Thanks for sharing the recipe.
I really like how quick this recipe was. It was really nice. I did add paprika and garlic. My family really enjoyed it.
It was good but a little bland. If I make it again I'll add some spices to it.
Good basic recipe. I made exactly but will add lots more flavor next time ! Thanks

I made this dish this morning and my family liked it. As someone suggested, I aqueezed the water out after grating the potatoes for crispiness. Instead of cheddard cheese, I used pepper jack for more spicy flavor!I'll make it again for sure.
I just made if for myself. Its quick, easy and mostly delicious:)

Fantasmic. :) I normally make cheese eggs w/ homefries so this was everything combined and I ended up using less egss n potatoes. Will make again and again. Looking forward to trying some of the suggestions for variety. Thanks!
has anyone tried to double this recipe and used two pie plates instead? I have a crowd to feed.

This is a fantastic recipe. If your potatoes are sticking, please consider the source to be your pan and/or cooking technique as opposed to the recipe. I used a well-seasoned cast iron pan with a bit of butter and grapeseed oil, and had delicious crispy potatoes and well-cooked eggs. Use your own discretion for seasoning: if you like a lot of flavor, add seasonings and salt and hot sauce for a kick...don't blame a simple recipe for not being seasoned enough for your tates...like onion? Add onion, like more cheese, add it...5 stars for simplicity, cost, and ease.
fabulous recipe and my husband just loved it. very easy to make too
Delicious! I added some broccoli, a 1/2 tsp garlic powder and touch of oregano. I also used 1 large potato and 6 eggs. I don't eat dairy so I used Daiya cheddar and it was fantastic!
What an easy basic recipe! I can't wait to play with it by adding other ingredients. Thanks for sharing!
You have to put the shredded potatoes in cold water or they will turn red.

The trick is getting the hash browns right! I finally discovered the secret after countless failures. Shred the hash potatoes and squeeze all the water out. Over the heated oil, put all the hash browns in a thin layer. Cook for 7 minutes and flip to cook another 7 or 8. I'm a bad flipper so I use a plate to help. You can add anything to this! I've used the recipe as stated, added and used garlic, paprika, Parmesan cheese mixed in w/ the eggs and always add turkey sausage on top. After I do the hash browns, I move to a shallow pie dish and dump the 6 eggs over it. The recipe is amazing, you just have to know how to do the hash browns right!

made this for my family of four tonight and i should have made MORE because everyone wanted seconds! didnt shred the potatoes, but sliced them, very thin. added to oil and spice in pan, but instead of cooking stovetop, i baked them in the oven for about 10 min. then back to the stovetop where i added the eggs. put back in oven for recommended time and then added cheese. served with sour cream and salsa!!! delicious!!!!

Finally, what I've been looking for. I added more eggs and mixed the cheese up in the egg before I poured it over the potatoes. Also added leftover broccoli & cauliflower - yum. Sprinkled garlic powder and Everglades seasoning in addition to salt and pepper. Deeeee LISH!
I even added chopped up spinach and some sausage. My husband and I loved it.
SO GOOD!!!!!
Really simple, and delicious. Yum with bacon on the side!

Good base recipe for a fritatta. Went over well at our holiday brunch. We added some extra spices such as garlic powder, onion powder, and parsley to make it a bit more to our tastes, but it was nice and easy to make! Thanks :)
The inside tasted pretty good, but the outside inch and a half or so got kind of weird and rubbery. Also, reheated very poorly I thought.
This is a great dish and I love that it only requires a few ingredients.
followed the recipe as is and the whole family loved it! Even my child who doesn't do breakfast food went back for seconds. An absolute keeper.

I tried this recipe today, and it was delicious! I cubed the potatoes, and added 1/2 of crumbled bacon to it; I just love that nice smoky flavor of bacon! :) I also tried the trick with beating the white part of the egg and yolk separately, and then combining them - it worked! They turned out to be very fluffy! Quick and easy! Now, Fritatta is one of my favorite breakfast dishes! :) Thank you for sharing the recipe!

I was tempted to make this recipe as it was written but logic told me it needed more. Isimply added garlic and much more it the way of spices. Also, I used a picante on the side for dipping. This would have earned it close to 5 stars.
This was really great! My family loved it. I made it just as described here and it turned out just fine. I will add some more spices next time because I really like spicy food.

This dish turned out well for the most part, made this for Mothers Day brunch and it was very much enjoyed. I added two more egg whites and did as another reviewer suggested, whisked the egg whites and yolks separately, and what a great tip! Very fluffy! I also added some thyme and sage for some added flavor. I will definitely use this again in the future!

This dish turned out well for the most part, made this for Mothers Day brunch and it was very much enjoyed. I added two more egg whites and did as another reviewer suggested, whisked the egg whites and yolks separately, and what a great tip! Very fluffy! I also added some thyme and sage for some added flavor. I will definitely use this again in the future!
A good, quick weeknight dinner. I will add more veggies for colour and taste next time.
Great with hot sauce!
this was really yummy! Okay to make it so much simpler just bake some potatos and let them cool then peel them. Cut that up and use it and just use a baking dish.
Very easy to make and my kids loved it! I'll be making this again very soon.
Easy & delicious - thanks

Good recipe! I made it with the Ore-Ida hash brown and did not cook the onion with the potatoes. I carmelized the onion separately and added both later, so that I got a sweeter taste. I also whipped the eggs whites (as suggested by someone) and folded in the yolks. I got a great fluffy frittata that was a hit!
great recipe for a quick dinner! the only change i made was i added more vegetables - but the recipe seems really adaptable!

This recipe was good, but a little dry. I might have cooked it for a tad too long. I tripled the recipe for a party and ended up cooking it in a 2-inch deep baking dish instead of a skillet. Worked perfectly. Added some garlic and seasoned salt to the mix. I would have added some spinach, but didn't have any on hand. It needed a bit more cheese than the recipe called for, but overall, I think I will definitely be making this again.

What a great basic recipe! You start with this and add what you like. For me, it's bacon! I fried bacon to crispy, cooked the frozen hashbrowns in the fat, and when I poured the eggs in topped with the crumbled bacon. Yummm! Would also be good with red bell pepper and/or mushrooms. Must try that. I've made this several times and like it more each time. Thamks

My son and I have made this several times. I decided to adjust the recipe to fill the skillet a little thicker. I used 4 or 5 potatoes, diced and 9 or 10 eggs. We use different spices and different cheeses every time we make this. We also have used bacon once and sausage another time. We have to bake it at 350 degrees because of my skillet's temperature restrictions, for about 12 to 15 minutes. Then top with lots of cheese and return to just melt the cheese. This makes enough for us to eat all day and maybe even for the next morning. My aunt had never had one and she loved it also. Thanks for sharing this great basic recipe.

Brilliant base recipe! This went down a treat in our house tonight. Added an extra egg (all beaten with an electric beater- nice & fluffy!), a red onion, peas, parsley, basil & tumeric. Will definitely make again.

Great tips from the others. I diced the potatoes, fried it, mixed it with fried onions, garlic and leek. Sprinkled chopped tomatoes, spring onions and fried bacon on top. Poured in the beaten eggs (white and yolks beaten separately). Served it with fruit. Excellent !

I read through reviews before making, and followed the following tips: I cubed my potatoes, added bacon, 6 eggs, mushrooms,a few types of cheeses and used seasoning salt too. I am not a huge fan of eggs, but I was able to enjoy. My husband thought it was very good!
This was very good, but next time I think I will cube the potatoes. I found that they didn't crisp up like I would have liked. I also added bacon to it as well which I will do again

So very good. I did make a couple adjustments. First, I used some baby red potatoes and pre-cooked them in the microwave for 5 minutes then chopped them. I added ground pepper, paprika, 1/4 chopped onion to the potatoes and sautéed for about 5 minutes. I then topped the potatoes mixture with some chopped sausage and finally the egg mixture. I cooked the rest of this according to the recipe. Even my four year old thought this was great!! I might recommend adding a few more eggs if you are looking for of that consistency! Otherwise, great recipe, that could have many different variations!!

It was good especially since I am not really an egg eater. I added some garlic, parmesan cheese and mushrooms. The only problem I had was frying up the potatoes. It was a gloopy messy. Next time I will buy pre-made hash browns.
REALLY REALLY good!!!!! Followed exact directions. Loved with with a dash of hot sauce on top. YUM!

2 tablespoons isn't enough oil to fry these potatoes, nor are 4 eggs enough to fill a 12 inch skillet. Either use a 10 inch or up to 6 eggs. It is also rather bland as is, but that just leaves the recipe open to interpretation.

Use more oil than specified. The potatoes stick to EVERYTHING if you don't. If the pan hadn't been salvageable I'd have taken another star. Beyond that, not bad. Not bad at all. I plan to make it again, but slight differences: 1) I'm going to fry some bacon in the pan first, use that oil, and crumble the bacon on top before I put the egg on. 2) I'm going to add some peppers, maybe even a bit of cilantro.
Love this recipe. Very easy to make and so delicious.

Fast and easy! The kids loved it (I scaled it to feed 6) and they wanted more. Next time I will double it. I whipped the egg whites as mentioned in one of the reviews, other than that I made it as directed and it came out great!
fast, easy and delicious.

This is a MUST try dish! I made this last night and is now one of my favourite recipes and I will be making it many more times. I diced the poatoes not shredded them. Added chopped red and organe bell peppers. Mixed some of the cheese into the dish before baking then added the last 1/4 of it to the top to brown before serving. I love this recipe site and love this dish!
My daughter loves this dish! I add crumbled breakfast sausage and a diced orange pepper (I saute it with the onion) so that there is more veggies.
awesome..just throw it all in and walla. yum.,

A good start, but would be bland without some additions based on previous reviews. Added garlic with the onion, shredded Parmesan with the egg, mushrooms, spinach, and cayenne. Great topped with sour cream!

I used Southwestern Style Simply Potatoes (found by eggs in grocery store) added diced tomato and ham. It was delicious!!! The Simply Potatoes made this recipe even easier. My family actually thought I bought the frittata pre-made from the store.

yum! did this in a large cast iron skillet to feed my mister & the teenager with what i thought would be leftovers: wrong. scarfed it all! *maybe next time a bit of a skip ahead with pre made hasbrowns...?*
This recipe is so good and so easy! I made it exactly like the recipe but I did increase the eggs by 2....my super finicky 17 year old son went back for seconds! This one is a keeper! Thanks!

I liked recipe and will make again with probably some small changes. It didn't have much taste, even with the onions I felt it was a little bland. I think adding some breakfast sausage or bell peppers would add flavor.... But overall I thought it was a great breakfast dish.
very good- i added salsa to mine
I diced potatoes and used 3 or 4 (loooove my potatoes) and also added some diced orange and red pepper.
I added Garlic to this and some fresh herbs..Really Yummy!!!

I baked tater tots and used those in place of the potatoes. I also chopped up and fried bacon with the onions, for my 12" cast iron skillet I increased the eggs to 9 and that gave it the volume I am use to in a frittata. It was great! Thanks.

I too use frozen shredded hash browns. This recipe is so easy to make and was a great hit with my husband. It could be a brunch or dinner meal. Mix it up with scallions, monteray jack with jalepenos, etc.;whatever suites your fancy.

I made this exactly as stated, but used EggBeaters instead of real eggs. It turned out very delicious:-) It is a nice quick, easy recipe to put together after a long day at work and provided leftovers for the next day for the two of us.
added sauteed peppers. liked this recipe much better than another I found with sliced potatoes - shredding really makes the difference.
It's ok, but it needs something...

took forever to cook the shredded potatoes -they didn't crisp up. Used a wrought iron pan - after addding th eggs and cooking in the oven, it was very thin, because of the size of the pan. Tasted ok....

Big disappointment. I fried my shredded potatoes for a good 30 mins. & they just never got past the gooey phase. I gave the recipe the benefit of the doubt & piled on the rest of the ingredients & tossed it all into the oven. The end result: nasty, gooey & it just wall went into the trash.
Delicious! The only change I made was to double the eggs and half the filling.
This was really good. Next time I'm gonna season the eggs before pouring it in the skillet.

Great basic recipe to customize. I added chopped red bell peppers. fresh basil, and chopped garlic to the potatoes and mixed ground cayenne, curry powder, milk and wheat germ into the eggs before adding to the potato mix. Topped it with grated medium cheddar. Was wonderful! Boyfriend loved it too!
It was OK, add less peper next time :)
Great Base Recipe! I used the recipe exactly, but added breakfast sausage also... Yummy Yummy Yummy!
This is quick and easy and nutritious, I included 6 eggs and chicken pieces and it turned out great!!

Hi new to the board but I use this website all the time. This was really easy bto do. I added the different cheeses and the bacon bits on the top like
suggested, as well as seasoning the potatoes while frying. My boyfriend who can live off of instant noodles loved it.
Thanks for this!

This was good, but I made a few changes and next time I will make some additional changes. I followed other's suggestions and increased the number of eggs to 6 and added garlic and additional spices -- dried oregano and a multi-purpose seasoning blend. I did not bake the frittata, but cooked it on the stovetop and then finished it under the broiler. I also added some crumbled bacon under the cheese.
The next time I make it, I will probably use frozen shredded hash browns. The fresh potatoes did not get as crispy as I would have liked, maybe too much moisture? I will also add the onions either before or with the potatoes rather than after. All in all, pretty tasty.
